Set a folder containing the Prettier mod: Set a folder containing the Prettier module. If unset, the extension first tries to resolve a workspace-specific installation, or uses the bundled module if 'Prefer Bundled Prettier' is enabled. If neither is available, the bundled module will be used as a fallback.
Use the bundled Prettier module and plug: Use the bundled Prettier module and plugins instead of resolving from the workspace. This is ignored if a custom Prettier module path is set.
Set a path to a custom Prettier configur:
Set a path to a custom Prettier configuration file. If unset, the extension will attempt to resolve one from the workspace or fall back to its own configuration.

Only files with JSON syntax are supported.
Ignore all configuration files and alway: Ignore all configuration files and always use the extension's configuration. This is ignored if a custom Prettier configuration file is set.
When enabled, Prettier⁺ will supplement: When enabled, Prettier⁺ will supplement Nova’s syntax detection with file‑extension fallback to choose the correct syntax. When disabled, it trusts Nova’s syntax detection only.
Send debug information to the Extension: Send debug information to the Extension Console.
Used for remote files, when no configura: Used for remote files, when no configuration file is found, or when configuration files are ignored.
Specify the line length that the printer: Specify the line length that the printer will wrap on.
Specify the number of spaces per indenta: Specify the number of spaces per indentation-level.
Indent lines with tabs instead of spaces: Indent lines with tabs instead of spaces.
Print semicolons at the ends of statemen: Print semicolons at the ends of statements.
Use single quotes instead of double quot: Use single quotes instead of double quotes.
Change when properties in objects are qu: Change when properties in objects are quoted.
Use single quotes instead of double quot: Use single quotes instead of double quotes in JSX.
Print trailing commas wherever possible: Print trailing commas wherever possible in multi-line comma-separated syntactic structures. (A single-line array, for example, never gets trailing commas.)
Print spaces between brackets in object: Print spaces between brackets in object literals.
Configure how Prettier wraps object lite: Configure how Prettier wraps object literals when they could fit on one line or span multiple lines.
Put the > of a multi-line HTML (HTML, JS: Put the > of a multi-line HTML (HTML, JSX, Vue, Angular) element at the end of the last line instead of being alone on the next line (does not apply to self closing elements).
Include parentheses around a sole arrow: Include parentheses around a sole arrow function parameter.
Prettier can restrict itself to only for: Prettier can restrict itself to only format files that contain a special comment, called a pragma, at the top of the file. This is very useful when gradually transitioning large, unformatted codebases to Prettier.
Prettier can insert a special @format ma: Prettier can insert a special @format marker at the top of files specifying that the file has been formatted with Prettier. This works well when used in tandem with the above Require Pragma option. If there is already a docblock at the top of the file then this option will add a newline to it with the @format marker.
Prettier can allow individual files to o: Prettier can allow individual files to opt out of formatting if they contain a special comment, called a pragma, at the top of the file.
By default, Prettier will not change wra: By default, Prettier will not change wrapping in markdown text since some services use a linebreak-sensitive renderer, e.g. GitHub comments and BitBucket. To have Prettier wrap prose to the print width, change this option to "always". If you want Prettier to force all prose blocks to be on a single line and rely on editor/viewer soft wrapping instead, you can use "never".
Specify the global whitespace sensitivit: Specify the global whitespace sensitivity for HTML, Vue, Angular, and Handlebars. See Prettier documentation for more info.
Vue files script and style tags indentat: Vue files script and style tags indentation
Whether or not to indent the code inside: Whether or not to indent the code inside <script> and <style> tags in Vue files.
Control whether Prettier formats quoted: Control whether Prettier formats quoted code embedded in the file.
Enforce single attribute per line in HTM: Enforce single attribute per line in HTML, Vue, and JSX.
Select whether to use global settings, e: Select whether to use global settings, enable, or disable the plugin.
Allows specifying the PHP version to use: Allows specifying the PHP version to use. The default setting 'auto', attempts to auto-detect the supported PHP version from a 'composer.json' file in the project folder. If not found or not able to be parsed, it will default to the latest supported PHP version.
Same as in Prettier. The default is '4': Same as in Prettier. The default is '4' based on the 'PSR-2' coding standard.
If enabled, strings that use double quot: If enabled, strings that use double quotes but do not rely on the features they add, will be reformatted.
If enabled, trailing commas will be adde: If enabled, trailing commas will be added wherever possible. If disabled, no trailing commas are printed.
If set to 'per-cs', prettier will move o: If set to 'per-cs', prettier will move open brace for code blocks (classes, functions and methods) onto new line. If set to '1tbs', prettier will move open brace for code blocks (classes, functions and methods) onto same line.
Adds a space before self-closing tags.
Orders XML attributes by key alphabetica: Orders XML attributes by key alphabetically while prioritizing xmlns attributes.
You may want 'ignore' or 'preserve', see: You may want 'ignore' or 'preserve', see the info.
Enable/disable attribute shorthand if at: Enable/disable attribute shorthand if attribute name and expression are the same.
Skips the formatting of the frontmatter.
Controls how attributes in Blade templat: Controls how attributes in Blade templates are wrapped across lines.
Minimum number of html tag attributes fo: Minimum number of html tag attributes for force wrap attribute options. Wrap the first attribute only if 'force-expand-multiline' is specified in wrap attributes.
Adds a newline at the end of the formatt: Adds a newline at the end of the formatted output.
Path to a custom Tailwind CSS config fil: Path to a custom Tailwind CSS config file. Only used when 'Sort Tailwind Classes' is enabled.
Controls the order in which HTML attribu: Controls the order in which HTML attributes are sorted.
Comma-separated list defining the custom: Comma-separated list defining the custom order of HTML attributes. Only applies when 'HTML Attribute Sorting' is set to 'custom'. Regex patterns are supported.
Skips running a PHP syntax check before: Skips running a PHP syntax check before formatting Blade templates.
Indents the content inside <head> and <b: Indents the content inside <head> and <body> tags.
Comma-separated list of tag names that s: Comma-separated list of tag names that should be preceded by an extra newline.
Adds trailing commas in PHP expressions: Adds trailing commas in PHP expressions where possible. If disabled, no trailing commas will be printed.
Specifies the PHP version used for parsi: Specifies the PHP version used for parsing Blade expressions. Affects syntax compatibility and formatting behavior.
Comma-separated list of component prefix: Comma-separated list of component prefixes used to preserve attribute formatting.
EJS markup formatter plugin for Prettier: EJS markup formatter plugin for Prettier
Used only if 'prettier-plugin-tailwindcs: Used only if 'prettier-plugin-tailwindcss' is disabled or Tailwind sorting is not enabled for the 'HTML (EJS)' syntax.
Select whether to use global settings, e:
Select whether to use global settings, enable, or disable the plugin.

Used only if 'prettier-plugin-tailwindcss' is disabled or Tailwind sorting is not enabled for the 'HTML (EJS)' syntax.
EJS template formatter and Tailwind CSS: EJS template formatter and Tailwind CSS class sorting plugin for Prettier
Requires both 'prettier-plugin-tailwindc: Requires both 'prettier-plugin-tailwindcss' and Tailwind sorting enabled for the 'HTML (EJS)' syntax.
Select whether to use global settings, e:
Select whether to use global settings, enable, or disable the plugin.

Requires both 'prettier-plugin-tailwindcss' and Tailwind sorting enabled for the 'HTML (EJS)' syntax.
Use single quotes instead of double quot: Use single quotes instead of double quotes in Liquid tag and objects.
Use single quotes instead of double quotes in embedded languages (JavaScript, CSS, TypeScript inside <script>, <style> or Liquid equivalent).
Specify the default whitespace sensitivi: Specify the default whitespace sensitivity of the 'capture' Liquid tag.
If enabled, will print <link> tags on a: If enabled, will print <link> tags on a single line to remove clutter.
If enabled, will indent the contents of: If enabled, will indent the contents of the {% schema %} tag.
NGINX configuration files formatter plug: NGINX configuration files formatter plugin for Prettier
Align directive parameters within a bloc: Align directive parameters within a block to the same column.
Align all directive parameters within a: Align all directive parameters within a file to the same column.
Wrap parameters to new lines to fit prin: Wrap parameters to new lines to fit print width.
Escape with \\u all non-Latin-1 characte: Escape with \u all non-Latin-1 characters, to allow safely encoding output as ISO-8859-1.
Set the separator to use between a prope: Set the separator to use between a property key and its value.
Specifies the formatter to use for SQL c: Specifies the formatter to use for SQL code formatting.
Sets the SQL dialect used for formatting: Sets the SQL dialect used for formatting. Choose 'Auto-Detect' to infer the dialect from the file extension (e.g., .pgsql → PostgreSQL, .sqlite → SQLite). Defaults to 'Generic SQL' if detection fails or the dialect is unsupported.
Newline before or after boolean operator: Newline before or after boolean operator (AND, OR, XOR).
Maximum number of characters in parenthe: Maximum number of characters in parenthesized expressions to be kept on single line.
How many newlines to insert between quer: How many newlines to insert between queries.
Specifies parameter values to fill in fo: Specifies parameter values to fill in for placeholders inside SQL.
Specifies parameter types to support whe: Specifies parameter types to support when parsing SQL prepared statements.
Sets the SQL dialect used for parsing. C: Sets the SQL dialect used for parsing. Choose 'Auto-Detect' to infer the dialect from the file extension (e.g., .pgsql → PostgreSQL). Defaults to 'MySQL' if detection fails or the dialect is unsupported.
Specifies whether to focus on tables or: Specifies whether to focus on tables or columns for parsing and formatting in SQL queries.
Tailwind CSS class sorting plugin for Pr: Tailwind CSS class sorting plugin for Prettier
Specifies the Tailwind JavaScript config: Specifies the Tailwind JavaScript config path.
Sorting order for classes in function ca: Sorting order for classes in function calls and tagged template literals.
If enabled, preserves original whitespac: If enabled, preserves original whitespace between classes. If disabled, removes unnecessary whitespace between classes for consistent formatting.
If enabled, preserves duplicate classes: If enabled, preserves duplicate classes when classes and templating syntax can’t be distinguished (e.g., in Fluid or Blade). If disabled, removes duplicate classes automatically for cleaner output.
Syntaxes where Tailwind CSS class sortin: Syntaxes where Tailwind CSS class sorting should be applied.
Align consecutive comments after entries: Align consecutive comments after entries and items vertically. This applies to comments that are after entries or array items.
Expand arrays to multiple lines that exc: Expand arrays to multiple lines that exceed the maximum column width.
Collapse arrays that don't exceed the ma: Collapse arrays that don't exceed the maximum column width and don't contain comments.
Omit white space padding from single-lin: Omit white space padding from single-line arrays.
Omit white space padding from the start: Omit white space padding from the start and end of inline tables.
Indent based on tables and arrays of tab: Indent based on tables and arrays of tables and their subtables, subtables out of order are not indented.
Alphabetically reorder keys that are not: Alphabetically reorder keys that are not separated by empty lines.
The maximum number of allowed blank line: The maximum number of allowed blank lines between entries and tables.
Use single quotes in Twig files.
Should objects always break in Twig file: Should objects always break in Twig files.
Follow the offical coding standards exac: Follow the offical coding standards exactly. If disabled, some slight deviations might occur, such as spaces around the filter operator (e.g. 's | upper' instead of 's|upper').
Choose whether to output the block name: Choose whether to output the block name in {% endblock %} tags (e.g., {% endblock content %}) or not.
A sequences of non-standard Twig tags th: A sequences of non-standard Twig tags that should be treated as belonging together.
Make custom Twig tests known to the pars: Make custom Twig tests known to the parser.
Automatically format documents when they: Automatically format documents when they are saved.
When enabled, documents without a Pretti: When enabled, documents without a Prettier configuration file will not be formatted on save.
When enabled, remote documents will be i: When enabled, remote documents will be ignored during format on save.
Documents that are set to an ignored syn: Documents that are set to an ignored syntax will not be formatted when saved.
The Swiss Army knife for formatting — fa: The Swiss Army knife for formatting — fast, reliable, and built on Prettier.
